title: @ Meddler Frostqueens
body: Any chance this unneeded "support" item is going to be removed? or at least changed so that Burst/Lategame mages wont be able to abuse it like they do now?

replies.body: No, we don't have any plans to remove the Frost Queen's line of items. They help various casters, usually more damage focused ones, to work as duo laners supporting an ADC. Thats something we feel's good for the game, in terms of the sort of lane match ups it enables and variety of play experiences it offers.  If all we were seeing were aggressive kill lanes then I'd agree there was a problem we should be fixing. Champions with high utility and team assisting kits are something it's great to see get played. We don't feel we should be forcing everyone that doesn't fit that description out of the support position though, it's a spot that can healthily include a range of classes (most commonly tanks, mages, tanky supports or caster supports)

Except there's a niche for everything. What do you pick for a support when your top laner is Malphite, jungle is Pantheon, mid is Yasuo and ADC is Jinx? You go straight AP because tankiness is covered, and AD is more than covered. You make up for lost utility by forcing the enemy team to build MR or get punished by you, while still keeping yourself relevant in a supporting role through the AP scalings of your utility spells. If nothing else, Frost Queen's Claim supports this wonderfully.

A support's role outside of vision is not simply to CC, it's to fill the gaps that your team lacks. If that means CC, pick Leona or Nautilus. If it's engage potential, pick Thresh or Blitzcrank. If it's sheer tankiness, pick Tahm or Braum. If that means disengage and safety, pick Janna or Janna. If that means AP, pick Annie or Sona. They all have CC, they all also excel at different things. Annie and Sona just happen to excel at melting faces. A carrying support is a support who succeeds at any of those things, when and where appropriate.

Remember that in the end whether or not the support gets the kill (which a skilled AP support is supposed to be able to avoid), more damage leads to faster kills which is also a very valid way of supporting. Let's assume I happen to snatch an early kill as Sona after a bad trade in which my ADC died. If i get a bit of AP with what i have i can perhaps bully away the enemy ADC and/or support, thus allowing my own ADC to farm more safely and helping him carry better, later. Supports having damage is not, and never was a bad thing and i don't understand why people think so.

The real issue with supports having damage is that if they steamroll some way or another, they may begin to think their role shifts from supporting to primary damage dealer, which is false, but that's a player mentality mistake, not necessarily a role one.

I rather disagree with you, as you forget to calculate the gold income in the cost. Every time you gain gold with it, it's basically it's price going down. By the end of a 40-50 minutes game where i'm not feeding, usually the cost of Frost Queen's Claim becomes 0, and it's cost becomes pure profit. I say that for an item that costs potentially 0 gold, Frost Queen's Claim is plenty powerful enough. (But feel free to buff it anytime you want!)

You also forget that by upgrading the item to it's max rank you can now kill minions without being punished, meaning that while you still shouldn't farm, at least last hitting a minion accidentally while poking won't cripple your item income. And excuse me, but DOUBLING the gold generation of the item seems very much worth the upgrade into Frostfang to me.

Compared to {{item:3303}} (after all nobody is saying spell thief is bad... if anything it is too good) the upgrade to {{item:3092}}  gives +5 gold each time the passive is proced which can happen at most once every 10 seconds
So for the upgrade from {{item:3303}}  to {{item:3092}}  to pay for itself (1835 gold)
the game would have to last 1835gold/5 gold per proc = 367 procs
If you stand and hit an enemy champion/tower all game long then it will take 367procs * 10 seconds recharge time = 3670 seconds or 61min and 10 seconds
(after you have bought frostfang which gives the increased gold)
(Also keep in mind that is 61min without going more then 30 seconds of hitting an enemy champion/tower... which will pretty much never ever happen so it will take even longer then that)

{{item:3098}} and {{item:3092}}  doesn't really give much more gold compared to {{item:3303}} ... so upgrading it for the "extra" gold is pointless and it is much better to just save the gold and just sit on {{item:3303}}  until you run out of inventory space/slots
